div.div: Learn leadership, entrepreneurship, innovation and life design

strong.br: An innovative, cutting-edge model of education for sustainability authorized by the State University of New York, New Roots is a tuition-free, public charter high school that is open to any New York State resident in grades 9-12.

div.p: A New Roots education empowers young people as leaders and entrepreneurs for the 21st century.Â Our focus on environmental stewardship, social justice and sustainable economics gives youth the skills of hands, heart and mind they will need to get ahead of the curve and create a successful adult life and career in this new century of dramatic technological, social and environmental change.

How?Â By offering engaging learning experiences that meet students where they are each and every day, putting their passions, interests, knowledge and skills to work to discover and unlock their potential.

p.strong: Itâs their future.Â And we do it like nobody else.

div.p: Field trips and projects exploring current issues and events make classroom learning relevant and meaningful.
Classes feature active learning, focusing on projects and presentations for real audiences, and internships for real-world career exploration and skills.
Our students develop systems thinking, leadership, and entrepreneurship skills to imagine and create innovative new ways of inventing opportunities.
All students enjoy a FREE breakfast and lunch featuring locally-sourced ingredients from our Farm to School meal program, every day!
Our school culture is inclusive and welcoming of every person. This student initiative is supported by team building, community development, and student participation in governance.

Our wellness program teaches practical techniques for focus and stress management rooted in neuroscience, mindfulness, healthy nutrition, and physical activity. Join our co-ed soccer team, our ultimate frisbee club or our cross country team! Or propose your own athletic club.
Restoring the natural world that sustains all life is essential to our well being. Our students learn how.
Upper school students (grades 11-12) earn college credit for required high school credits and electives.
Join a band, create a band, produce beats, and rhyme with your friends. Expand your imagination as you prepare for Rootstock, an annual youth music celebration at the Bernie Milton Pavilion.

p.em: Environmental Engineering, PhD program, Notre Dame (Awarded the Schmidt Fellowship by Notre Dame University)

p.strong: The inspiration I received at New Roots has helped me to approach new challenges in creative ways, and helped me to feel at home at Babson College, which is the #1 entrepreneurship college in the US.
New Roots gave me the opportunity to learn about public policy. I learned how to get my voice heard.
New Roots helped me explore my interests and think about where I want to go in life.
New Roots encouraged me to step up and ask questions, and to volunteer for opportunities that I might otherwise have felt unqualified for.
My New Roots experience gave me a real understanding of how to work in college through the many college-level courses.

div.div:
New Roots Charter School was founded in 2009. We are a regional, tuition-free public high school located in the heart of downtown Ithaca.
Any student ages 13-21 who is eligible to attend public high school in New York State is welcome to attend, regardless of district of residency.
